DataElement.preferredName: Persistent Progressive Neoplasm Post Radiation Therapy Diagnosis Ind-4
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable as related to post radiation therapy tumor progression or persistent disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Persistent Progressive Neoplasm Post Radiation Therapy Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to post radiation therapy tumor progression or persistence.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Retained; never-ceasing.:Advancing in extent or severity.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has progression been document
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has progression been documented or a biopsy obtained to confirm persistent disease at least 90 days following completion of radiation treatment
